alert.note: Alert for Lyon; Sioux (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 10:31AM CDT until further notice by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... South Dakota...Minnesota... Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. Big Sioux River at Brandon affecting Minnehaha, Lyon and Lincoln Counties. Big Sioux River near Estelline affecting Brookings and Hamlin Counties. Medary Creek near Medary affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Sioux, Lyon and Lincoln Counties. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Sioux, Union and Lincoln Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Big Sioux River near Canton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1235.0 feet, flooding begins to affect significant amounts of crop and pasture land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 1235.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 1236.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 1235.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Big Sioux River Canton 1235.0 1235.3 Tue 9 am MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1215 PM CDT.
